@graph.name: Frightful Ghost Cookie Recipe
@graph.description: An easy 3 ingredient (no bake!) ghost cookie that the kids will love eating this Halloween.
recipeIngredient: 8-10 oz white chocolate melting wafers (Ghirardelli is a great brand) (or almond bark)

recipeInstructions.text: Prep a baking sheet by lining with parchment paper or wax paper. Lay all the Milano cookies on the parchment or wax paper.Pro Tip: choose a baking sheet that will fit in your fridge!!
recipeInstructions.name: Prep a baking sheet by lining with parchment paper or wax paper. Lay all the Milano cookies on the parchment or wax paper.Pro Tip: choose a baking sheet that will fit in your fridge!!

recipeInstructions.text: Melt the white chocolate using either a double boiler or microwave.
recipeInstructions.name: Melt the white chocolate using either a double boiler or microwave.

recipeInstructions.text: Place a Milano cookie in the melted chocolate. Using a fork flip it around in the white chocolate, then pick it up on the fork and let any excess chocolate drip off.
recipeInstructions.name: Place a Milano cookie in the melted chocolate. Using a fork flip it around in the white chocolate, then pick it up on the fork and let any excess chocolate drip off.

recipeInstructions.text: Place on the paper lined baking sheet. Repeat with all the cookies.
recipeInstructions.name: Place on the paper lined baking sheet. Repeat with all the cookies.

recipeInstructions.text: While the chocolate is still wet, place two mini chocolate chips close together at the top for the eyes, then one under the eyes for the mouth.
recipeInstructions.name: While the chocolate is still wet, place two mini chocolate chips close together at the top for the eyes, then one under the eyes for the mouth.

recipeInstructions.text: Pop in the fridge to help the white chocolate set up, about 15-20 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Pop in the fridge to help the white chocolate set up, about 15-20 minutes.

itemListElement.text: You can store your Ghost Cookies at room temp in an airtight container. Or in the fridge (especially if you have a warm kitchen)!
